ai-tha-ap108:1.1_0: “A Buddha praised the appearance of a golden palanquin,
ai-tha-ap108:1.3_0: Like an iron crossing the flood,
ai-tha-ap108:1.4_0: Burning is burning with the sacrifice;
ai-tha-ap108:2.2_0: I threw a stone down in the sky,
ai-tha-ap108:2.3_0: the hero, the one who understands
ai-tha-ap108:2.4_0: The Buddha was the compassionate side of the hermits.
ai-tha-ap108:3.1_0: The Teacher standing in the sky,
ai-tha-ap108:4.4_0: Would he be reborn in a bad place?’
ai-tha-ap108:5.1_0: Through that deed and its result,
ai-tha-ap108:5.4_0: having left victory and defeat behind.
ai-tha-ap108:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Pūraṇa Kassapa.
